```{r}

library(readr)
test_data <- read_csv("data/house-prices-advanced-regression-techniques/test.csv")
train_data <- read_csv("data/house-prices-advanced-regression-techniques/train.csv")
train_data
test_data

housing_model <- lm(OverallCond ~ SaleType + SaleCondition + YrSold + YearBuilt + YearRemodAdd, data = train_data)
pred <- predict(housing_model, newdata = test_data)

ggplot(test_data, aes(x = OverallCond, y = pred)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_abline(slope = 1, intercept = 0, linetype = "dashed", color = "red") +
  labs(title = "Real vs Predicted Values",
       x = "True Overall Condition of House",
       y = "Predicted Overall Condition of House")

mse <- mean((test_data$OverallCond - pred)^2)
r_squared <- summary(housing_model)$r.squared
cat('Mean Squared Error:', mse, '\n')
cat('R-squared:', r_squared, '\n')
```
research question:

DOES THE SALE TYPE OR CONDITION OF A HOUSE AFFECT THE QUALITY OF THE AMENITIES INSIDE OF IT?
- maybe too broad, focus on specific part of something inside of the house

Does the sale type of the house affect its overall quality?
